title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: GST 2.0 comes as booster shot for Uttarakhand economy
items.summary: - **GST reforms** reduce taxes from *12% to 5%*, boosting competitiveness for farmers, artisans, and tourism-related businesses in Uttarakhand.\n- Lower rates benefit key sectors such as agriculture (pahari toor dal, red rice, GI Lakhori Mirchi), cottage industries, and the hotel/tourism segment through higher demand.\n- Automobiles clusters and SIDCUL's medical devices park gain from GST cuts, supporting jobs and investment, with tourism, handicrafts, and food processing also set to benefit.

items.title: Dr Reddy's Srikakulam unit: USFDA VAI
items.summary:
- Dr Reddy's Srikakulam facility received the USFDA Establishment Inspection Report classifying the outcome as *Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI)*, with the inspection officially closed.
- The USFDA conducted *GMP* and *Pre-Approval Inspection (PAI)* at the *FTO 11* formulations facility in *Srikakulam*, noting some objectionable conditions but no immediate regulatory action.
- The company said the Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) was received on October 20, 2025 and disclosed the *VAI* outcome on October 21, 2025.

items.title: Diwali Snack Wars: New kids aim to bite into India’s legacy brands
Trump warns of 155% tariffs on China if talks fail
items.summary:
- Trump warned that if trade talks fail, **155% tariffs** could be imposed on Chinese goods from November 1. 
- He said the US hopes China will buy **soybeans** and noted a planned meeting with Xi Jinping in South Korea, calling the relationship "very good." 
- The report also notes Beijing's moves to tighten exports of **rare earth materials**, while US tariffs push total duties on Chinese imports to around 55–57%.

items.title: China files complaint, says India's PLI schemes for auto, EV policy violate WTO norms
Archer Aviation strikes Korean Air deal for eVTOL air taxis
items.summary:
- Archer Aviation signed a partnership with Korean Air to commercialise its **Midnight** eVTOL in **South Korea** with a potential up to **100 aircraft**. 
- The deal highlights a race among eVTOL developers to win **regulatory approvals**, secure airline partners, and move from prototypes to paid service. 
- Backed by **Boeing** and **Stellantis**, Archer serves **United Airlines** and the owner of **India's IndiGo**, even as it projects EBITDA losses.

items.title: India's 6% rare earth reserves aim for global leadership
items.summary:
- India holds about *6%* of global rare earth reserves and aims to be a credible alternative in the clean-energy supply chain. 
- Reforms under the MMDR Act, PLI schemes, and initiatives like **KABIL** and **MSP**, along with IREL's new facilities, bolster domestic mining and processing. 
- With China dominating supply, India could reshape the global market as demand is projected to grow *300–700%* by 2040.

items.title: Germany's Merz calls for deregulation to aid chemicals industry
items.summary:
- **Merz** calls for EU deregulation, urging simpler **EU REACH** rules to boost Germany's chemicals industry and revive the *economy*. 
- He argues that reducing bureaucracy and giving industry more time to adjust to carbon tariffs would lower costs and spur growth. 
- Industry leaders warn Germany's chemical plants are running at low capacity and need policy support to stay competitive.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc to boost silver output by 30% as price surges
Canada offers tariff relief to some steel, aluminum products from US, China
Sandvik's orders rise on strong mining equipment demand amid gold rush
IKEA buys €720m forest deal to secure furniture supply
items.summary:
- Ingka Investments buys 153,000 hectares of forest land in Latvia and Estonia for €720 million to secure a supply of *sustainable raw material* for IKEA.
- The plan is generational forest management with *Baltic sawmills* to process wood regionally, expanding holdings to ~331,000 hectares.
- The deal lifts Ingka’s investments past €1 billion, adding Locus AI logistics and a Manhattan store project, with regulatory approvals pending.

items.title: Merck begins $3B Virginia manufacturing facility
items.summary:
- **Merck** has begun construction of a $3B pharmaceutical manufacturing facility in Elkton, **Virginia**, as part of a broader *$70B* US investment to expand manufacturing and R&D. 
- The plant is expected to add about **500 jobs** and bolster domestic drug production and supply-chain resilience. 
- Merck also plans further US investments in **biologics** and small‑molecule sites (e.g., Rahway, NJ), signaling a sustained shift to US manufacturing.

items.title: Centre speeds up mine operation via new rules
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - The *Mineral (Auction) Rules, 2015* were amended to introduce intermediary timelines and a **Project Monitoring Unit (PMU)** to speed up the operationalisation of auctioned mines. - Penalties for delays exist, and if milestones are achieved early, any penalties may be adjusted against the **auction premium**. - Early production incentives include halving the payable auction premium for minerals dispatched before five years (seven years for Composite Licences), aiming to deter squatting.

items.title: Reliance Industries’ ₹1.5 lakh crore new energy venture to boost revenue from next year
Nuclear security agency begins furloughing workers as part of shutdown, energy secretary says
Dixon Technologies shares fall 3% after Q2 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
Arm expands AI licensing to boost on-device AI market
items.summary:
- Arm is expanding its *Flexible Access* licensing to cover the Armv9 edge AI platform, targeting startups and device makers pursuing *on-device AI*. 
- The program lets firms use Arm’s design tools and training at little or no cost, with early supporters like *Raspberry Pi*, *Hailo*, and *SiMa.ai* helping shorten design cycles. 
- Arm aims to strengthen its position in the competitive *edge AI* space as 300+ companies join and 400 chip designs are ready for manufacturing, amid rivals such as **Nvidia** and Intel.

items.title: Chip crunch: How the AI boom is stoking prices of less trendy memory
Apple hits first record of 2025 as iPhone optimism fuels rebound
Semiconductor firms turn to IITs and NITs for niche talent
Taiwan Turns to Urban Mining to Counter China Curbs
items.summary:
- *Taiwan is turning to urban mining to reclaim rare earths and strengthen its semiconductor supply chain amid China's export curbs.*
- *Global recycling momentum, including Apple’s initiatives, supports a circular economy and broader rare earth recovery.*
- *Taiwan aims for closer ties with the US to build a resilient, **non-red supply chain** for critical minerals.*

items.title: European aerospace groups eye satellite merger
items.summary:
- The framework deal brings together *Leonardo*, *Airbus*, and *Thales* to merge their satellite units into a single pan-European company aiming to challenge *Starlink*.
- The talks, code-named **Project Bromo**, remain subject to board and regulatory approvals, with governance and valuation as key sticking points.
- A European Commission antitrust review is a major hurdle, and the deal could take up to two years to implement as Europe seeks to scale its satellite manufacturing.

items.title: TKMS rides defence boom to stock market debut
items.summary:
- *TKMS* rode a defence boom to a blockbuster **stock market debut** in Frankfurt, with shares around **€81** and a valuation of **>€5 billion**.
- *Thyssenkrupp* keeps a **51% stake** as TKMS lists, making it one of the world's largest naval builders and backing an **€18.6 billion** backlog.
- The listing mirrors a wider defence-spending rebound and KNDS IPO chatter, with expansion talks and a potential Thyssenkrupp steel-unit sale to *Jindal Steel International*.

items.title: Move over FMCG, auto to take advertising crown
Germany plans to order 15 more US-made F-35 jets, says source
items.summary:
- Germany plans to buy 15 more **F-35** jets from *Lockheed Martin*, bringing its total to 50 to replace the aging **Tornado** fleet. 
- The projected cost is about **€2.5 billion**, funded by a broader defence budget, with the F-35s' mission to carry U.S. **nuclear weapons** stored in Germany. 
- The move could strain Franco-German FCAS talks, highlighting tensions over Europe’s fighter-jet projects.

items.title: India developing 200 MW nuclear reactors to power ships
items.summary:
- India is developing compact **55 MW** and **200 MW** nuclear reactors that can be deployed on ships.
- The plan includes **private sector** participation in civil nuclear power, fuel procurement, and liability caps under amendments to the Atomic Energy Act and CLND.
- PM Modi aims for **100 GW** of nuclear capacity by 2047, reshaping India's energy mix and naval capabilities.

items.title: JSW Steel sees stronger consumption in H2 on lower rates, pent-up demand
MeitY readies list of imported electronic inputs for duty cuts
OpenAI big chip orders dwarf its revenues -- for now
BFSI, retail and manufacturing to drive Salesforce growth in India: Arundhati Bhattacharya
Glenmark recalls US product over manufacturing issue (USFDA)
items.summary:
- **Glenmark Pharmaceuticals Inc., USA** recalled 26,928 packs of Viorele and Ethinyl Estradiol tablets in the US after a manufacturing issue flagged by the **USFDA**. 
- The affected lot, produced at the Goa facility, is part of a **Class II** recall due to 'failed impurities/degradation specifications'. 
- Action announced on September 3, 2025; *India* hosts the most **USFDA-compliant** pharma plants outside the US.

items.title: Hydrogen blending pact by KPI, Ammonia and Desco
items.summary:
- KPI Green Hydrogen, Ammonia and Desco Infratech will drive *hydrogen-natural gas blending* in the city gas distribution network to cut carbon emissions and utilize existing infrastructure.
- The collaboration aims to reduce LNG imports and accelerate India's *clean energy transition*, in line with **Aatmanirbhar Bharat**.
- Naveriya Gas will integrate the blended fuel into the distribution network to ensure a sustainable, reliable supply and support India's *net-zero emissions* pledge.

items.title: India-US talks progress; Goyal pledges MSME/farmer/fisherman
items.summary:
- The India-US talks on the proposed bilateral trade agreement (**BTA**) are progressing in a cordial atmosphere, with India pledging to safeguard *MSME*, *farmers*, and *fishermen*. 
- Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal says talks are ongoing and not deadline-driven; there can be no agreement until India’s interests are fully addressed, with five rounds completed and the first tranche targeted by fall 2025. 
- India’s exports are expected to grow in 2025-26 despite tariffs; first-half growth was about *6-7%*, and GST-rate cuts have largely been passed to consumers, with action possible for laggards.

items.title: TN's first solar-plus-battery project marks 24/7 power
items.summary:
- **TNGECL** approves two grid-connected solar projects with 45 MWh storage (15 MW each) in Karur and Tiruvarur on a 25-year BOO model.
- The projects enable time-shifting of solar to peak hours, cutting costs and thermal dependence, with a levelised tariff around **₹6.49** per unit (vs peak exchange rates up to **₹10**).
- Over 25 years, estimated savings of about **₹90 crore** for TNPDCL, signaling dispatchable *green power* and serving as a learning platform for large-scale battery integration.

items.title: Mangalam Worldwide Q2 net profit up 52% to ₹10.53 cr
items.summary:
- Mangalam Worldwide reported a 52% YoY rise in consolidated *net profit* to ₹10.53 crore for the quarter ended Sept 30, aided by higher *revenues* of ₹318.52 crore.
- Adjusted *EBITDA* was ₹21.50 crore, up 59% YoY from ₹13.48 crore, signaling improving operating margins.
- MD Chandragupt Prakash Mangal highlighted a focus on *value-added products* to boost margins as the company expands capacity to 1,80,000 metric tonnes and moved to the NSE mainboard.

items.title: Work begins to restore power to Zaporizhzhia plant
items.summary:
- Work has begun to restore power to Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, a move the IAEA says is crucial for *nuclear safety* and *security* after a four‑week outage. 
- Russian and Ukrainian forces have established special ceasefire zones to allow repairs, with Ukrainian specialists reconnecting lines to the grid as repairs proceed. 
- The plant, Europe’s largest, remains out of service in a Russian‑controlled area and must be cooled to prevent a nuclear incident, underscoring ongoing risk.

items.title: Reliance to begin solar power generation from Kutch project in H1 FY27
Otter Controls India opens new $4.5 million manufacturing facility in Pune
NCLT set aside insolvency plea against ZTE filed by TVS Supply Chain
Rajasthan clears ₹1,200 crore electric bus unit
items.summary:
- *RIICO* allocated 65.56 acres (2,65,329 sqm) of land in the *Ghiloth Industrial Area* to *PMI Electro Mobility Solutions Private Limited* for an electric bus unit.
- The project involves about *₹1,200 crore* investment and is expected to create over *500 jobs*, as part of the Rising Rajasthan Investment Summit MoU.
- It will boost Rajasthan’s *e-mobility* ecosystem, expand local supply chains, and position the state as a hub for electric transportation.

items.title: UltraTech Cement approves ₹10,255 crore fresh capex to boost production capacity
Hector Beverages posts ₹46 cr FY25 profit; 16.3% sales rise
items.author: BE Staff
items.summary:
- *Hector Beverages*, which operates *Paperboat*, reported a net profit of ₹46 crore for FY25.
- Its sales rose 16.3% to ₹668.3 crore, with FY25 revenue of ₹682.4 crore and EBITDA of ₹68.5 crore.
- In FY24 the company posted a net loss of ₹334.1 crore with ₹574.5 crore in sales, highlighting a strong turnaround in FY25.

items.title: Rare earth material used in defence, medical equipements crucial for India: Rajnath Singh
Vestas shelves Polish wind-turbine plant on weak EU demand
items.summary:
- *Vestas* has shelved plans for its largest factory in *Poland*, citing weaker-than-expected demand for offshore wind in *Europe*. 
- The Poland plant, expected to create over *1,000* jobs and start operations in *2026*, has been paused due to lower demand. 
- It said it will continue investing in a *local manufacturing footprint* where offshore wind market volume and certainty allow.

items.title: Tibet renewables push sparks environmental concerns
items.summary:
- *Tibet* hosts vast mineral deposits and massive hydro and solar projects, fueling **renewables** growth but risking downstream water and ecosystems.
- **Lithium mining** feeds global battery makers but threatens rivers and Tibetan herders, with limited local benefit.
- Dissent over environmental damage is met with repression, underscoring the need for *transparency*, *community participation*, and human rights protections.

items.title: GST reforms boost festive demand, ₹20L cr consumption
items.summary:
- *GST reforms* rolled out on 22 September 2025 are lifting consumption and investment, with electronics and automobile sectors recording near-record activity.
- *Nirmala Sitharaman* says the tax benefit from the reforms has been passed on to end consumers, delivering price cuts on everyday items.
- The reforms are expected to generate economy-wide ripple effects, lifting demand to about **₹20 lakh crore** this year and boosting private investment through FY 2026.

items.title: WOL3D unveils BRAHMA: India's largest 3D farm
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- WOL3D has launched BRAHMA, India’s largest consumer 3D printing farm, with a planned installation of over 200 printers.
- The facility blends *FDM* and *SLA* technologies, plus a design studio, rapid prototyping lab and a customer experience zone, designed to run 24x7 and scale from about 10,000 parts per week to 50,000.
- BRAHMA is part of a broader push for *on-demand* manufacturing, bridging design and production and expanding WOL3D’s network across India and global markets.

items.title: US permits Boeing to boost production on 737 MAX
items.summary: - The **FAA** approved boosting 737 MAX monthly output to 42 from 38 after safety reviews. - Boeing says the rate rise will be implemented with *safety and quality* at the forefront and with suppliers. - The move signals improved **regulator relations** and is expected to bolster Boeing's finances due to deliveries, though the company has posted losses in recent years.

items.title: Rajnath Singh inaugurates first batch of locally manufactured BrahMos missiles in Lucknow
